intro: Allionia gausapoides, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a yellow center. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous terrain, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Allionia gausapoides is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
